greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of elements of alternating group A_n having order k, for n >= 1, 1<=k<=A051593(n).
reference: J. H. Conway, R. T. Curtis, S. P. Norton, R. A. Parker and R. A. Wilson, ATLAS of Finite Groups. Oxford Univ. Press, 1985.
Koda, Tatsuhiko; Sato, Masaki; Takegahara, Yugen; 2-adic properties for the numbers of involutions in the alternating groups. J. Algebra Appl. 14 (2015), no. 4, 1550052 (21 pages).
link: Index entries for sequences related to groups
mathematica: row[n_] := (orders = PermutationOrder /@ GroupElements[AlternatingGroup[n] ]; Table[Count[orders, k], {k, 1, Max[orders]}]); Table[row[n], {n, 1, 9}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 31 2016 *)
results.author: _Roger Cuculière_, Oct 29 2000
ext: More terms from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 01 2000
Inserted missing zero in the row for A_9. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 27 2015
